WRITING.TEXT: After seeing Batman vs Superman and being somewhat disappointed, I thought this would be redemption but no. Way. In. Hell.

Completely sorry about that. With me and my close ones, we've all been raised with the "tough love" stuff so even in grief, we kept a straight face and just kept acting like we were okay, even if it was obvious to people we weren't. At least when you're shitty to yourself, you're being more honest than acting okay.
This just made me cringe so hard.
Denial. Trying to constantly prove that you're feeling okay.
Because, in some weird twisted way, it's considered "trendy"
The movie Trumbo affected me because it was then that I really knew that I couldn't suppress trying to be a writer any longer.
Who it was depends on everything.
Finally! I am currently rewatching all of them and am on season 6 as I write this lol. It's supposed to be an up-in-the-air sort of thing but let's make this fun. You're the unsub.

WRITING.TITLE: What would you do if your life suddenly became a Criminal Minds episode?
